analysis_metadata.document_title: Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations

ambiguous_language.description: The text header states 'Page 29' while the page number is listed as '23'. This is a contradiction.
Implies a standard front setback of 20' which is not defined in the provided text. This indicates a dependency on an external or unstated base rule.
Implies a standard street side setback of 16' for corner lots (as established in Figure B), which this rule modifies.
No specific setback dimensions (constants) are provided for 'Through lot' or 'Lot with more than 4 sides', despite the key indicating 'Required setbacks' are a component of the diagrams.

Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots with a 'flag' shape, having a narrow access strip to a public street.

Conditions.description: The 'Front lot line' is defined as the lot line closest and most parallel to the street.

Exceptions.description: The front setback is 10 feet, which is an exception to a presumed standard of 20 feet.

cross_references: Implied reference to a standard front setback rule (20 feet).

Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots with frontage on two intersecting streets.
exclusions: Does not apply to substandard corner lots with frontage < 50' (see FIG-C).

hierarchical: This rule serves as the base case for the exception defined in FIG-C-SUBSTANDARD-CORNER-LOT.

Qualifiers.scope: Setback determination for substandard corner lots.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to corner lots where one frontage is less than 50 feet.

dimensional.name: Frontage Length
dimensional.description: The length of the lot line abutting a street.

Conditions.description: This rule is triggered if any street frontage is less than 50 feet.
The 'Front lot line' is defined as the shortest of the two street frontages.

Exceptions.description: The street side setback is reduced to 10 feet instead of the standard 16 feet for corner lots.

hierarchical: This rule is a special case of the 'Corner Lot' rule (FIG-B-CORNER-LOT).
cross_references: Refers to and modifies the rule from FIG-B-CORNER-LOT.
logical_dependencies: Activation of this rule is dependent on the 'Frontage Length' variable being less than the 'Frontage Threshold' constant.

Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots with frontage on two opposite, parallel streets.

Conditions.description: A through lot is defined as having streets on opposite, parallel sides. This implies two front yards.

Qualifiers.scope: Rear yard determination for wedge shaped lots.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to lots with a wedge shape, typically with a curved front lot line and side lot lines that would intersect.

Conditions.description: The rear yard is determined by constructing a 20' radius arc from the theoretical intersection of the side lot lines.

Exceptions.description: Wedge shaped lots do not have a rear lot line in the traditional sense. The rear yard is a constructed area, not one defined by a lot line.

regulations.rule_name: Lot Line Determination for Lots with More Than 4 Sides

Qualifiers.scope: Rear lot line determination for lots with more than 4 sides.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to polygonal lots with more than four sides.

Conditions.description: The 'Rear lot line' is defined as the lot line that is farthest from and most parallel to the street.

cross_references: Figure F shows an example of this lot type, while Figure G provides the specific definitional rule.
